intro: Spermacoce phyteumoides var. phyteumoides, commonly known as the common moonflower, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features opposite, lanceolate leaves with a hairy surface, and it produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in warm, humid climates.
